results.title: Affliction
results.creator_credit: Linda Reisman, Largo Entertainment, Reisman, Kingsgate Prod and Paul Schrader
results.brief_description: A dark exploration of working-class family relationships, “Affliction” stars Nick Nolte as Wade Whitehouse, a divorced New Hampshire sherif who is dealing with a spoilt petulant daughter, a furious ex-wife, and a increasingly hostile alcoholic father (James Coburn). When a hunting accident occurs in his township, Wade suspects murder and sees an opportunity to make a hero of himself and finally receive the respect of both his daughter and his father. But as the investigation becomes murkier and Wade finds powerful forces aligned against him, he begins to spiral out of control and to give into the violence and alcohol abuse that is his family legacy. Paul Schrader’s thriller, like his entire oeuvre, is as much a study in repression and masculine resentment as it is a conventional murder mystery. Wade is a classic archetype of a fool, a man who always wishes to do good, but whose abuse as a child has led him to distrust women, himself, and to react with violence and anger whenever his authority is challenged. The bleakness of Wade’s life is rooted in the history of his parent’s relationship and even the counseling of his sympathetic girlfriend (Sissy Spacek), and his estranged brother (Willem Dafoe) cannot offer him any hope. James Coburn won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for his role in this film and the entire cast is informally excellent. Based on the novel by Russell Banks.

results.title: Affair in Trinidad
results.brief_description: An American woman working as a dancer in Trinidad with her artist husband (Neil Emery), is gradually drawn into a web of secret police deals and espionage when her husband is found dead, believed murdered. She, the only ‘key’, is used to obtain evidence against his murderers. His brother arrives to be confronted by his brother’s death. Suspicious, he seeks to find out the truth, falling in love with his dead brother’s wife on the way. Cast includes Rita Hayworth, Glenn Ford, Alexander Scourby and Valerie Bettis (who was also responsible for choreographing Rita Hayworth’s dance sequences). Costume designer Jean Louis was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Costume.

results.title: Aetna: a volcanic eruption on the island of Sicily
results.brief_description: Records, un-narrated, with only a descriptive jazz score, the basic stages of an eruption of Mount Aetna, on the east coast of Sicily. It gives a non-verbal picture of one of the most dramatic of natural events, and is also an indirect portrait of Aetna itself.

results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Shepherd boy and the Wolf ; The Fox and the grapes ; The Hare and the Tortoise ; The Cat and the Mouse ; The Hare and the Hound ; The Raven and the Swan and The lion, the ass and the fox.

results.title: Aerodynamics: Forces acting on an air foil
results.brief_description: Explains the theory and principles of forces acting on air foils. Tells of the development and use of wind tunnels to measure forces on wing form.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Intermediate
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: The 30 minute Intermediate program has a more rigorous pace, and the exercises used are more demanding with fewer repetitions. The tape requires a good basic level of fitness, and assumes a level of flexibility and co-ordination such as would be developed through a consistent use of the Beginners Program. For many exercisers, and for elderly exercisers in particular, the intermediate program may be as far as they wish to go. Rated: G

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Beginners
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: The 30 minute “Beginners” program is at a gently demanding pace and is suitable for anyone who has not been actively involved in an exercise program within the past three months. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Advanced
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: For people seeking a high level of fitness, the 50 minute advanced tape offers a stimulating challenge. The exercises involved are complex, very demanding and require agility, flexibility, co-ordination and good aerobic fitness. Under no circumstances should this program be attempted before a suitable fitness level has been achieved with a thorough and regular fitness building program. The advanced program will not be attainable by all age groups; older exercisers will find the first two programs more suited to their requirements. Rated: G

results.title: Aerobic exercising
results.brief_description: Aerobic exercising is shown as a means to enhance lifestyle and increase lifespan. Emphasizes the need for sensible preparation for any fitness program including aerobics, as well as giving attention to safety aspects.
